docs.abstract: Mr. Barr, then the attorney general, rejected a plea deal days after Mr. Floyd died, worried in part of protesters calling it lenient. Derek Chauvin was set to plead guilty to third-degree murder.
docs.snippet: Mr. Barr, then the attorney general, rejected a plea deal days after Mr. Floyd died, worried in part of protesters calling it lenient. Derek Chauvin was set to plead guilty to third-degree murder.
docs.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — It was three days after George Floyd died in police custody last May, and businesses in the Twin Cities were on fire. Police officers were shooting rubber bullets and tear gas to hold back protesters, their anger fueled by a cellphone video of Mr. Floyd, a Black man, gasping for breath under the knee of a white officer.

headline.main: Why William Barr Rejected a Plea Deal in the George Floyd Killing
headline.print_headline: City Torn Apart Over Police Shooting Braces for a Trial

docs.abstract: Joyce Fernandes was a third-generation maid — until an employer caught her reading a book. Now a rapper, author and TV host, she is spurring “uncomfortable” conversations on race.
docs.snippet: Joyce Fernandes was a third-generation maid — until an employer caught her reading a book. Now a rapper, author and TV host, she is spurring “uncomfortable” conversations on race.
docs.lead_paragraph: SÃO PAULO, Brazil — It was a cherished ritual that Joyce Fernandes saved for the end of the shift of a job she despised.

headline.main: ‘I Was Invisible’: The Maid-Turned-Star Who’s Taking On Racism in Brazil
headline.print_headline: Invisible No More, an Author Holds Up a Mirror to Racism in Brazil

docs.abstract: Miami New Drama gave audiences a window on the “Seven Deadly Sins” when it took over part of a pedestrian mall for a production.
docs.snippet: Miami New Drama gave audiences a window on the “Seven Deadly Sins” when it took over part of a pedestrian mall for a production.
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — As the final performance of Miami New Drama’s “Seven Deadly Sins” ended Sunday night, the actors streamed onto Lincoln Road, thanking the company’s artistic director, Michel Hausmann. They had spent months performing separately, inside adjacent vacant storefronts on this South Beach pedestrian mall, to an audience that watched and listened from a distance.

headline.main: Bringing Stages to Storefronts in a Theater-Hungry City
headline.print_headline: Bringing Stages to Storefronts in Miami Beach

docs.abstract: A Buffalo area court officer did not face a disciplinary hearing after he wrote a Facebook post saying George Floyd “deserved what he got.”
docs.snippet: A Buffalo area court officer did not face a disciplinary hearing after he wrote a Facebook post saying George Floyd “deserved what he got.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Just days after George Floyd’s death, a court officer in New York posted two pictures side-by-side on his Facebook page.

headline.main: After Officer’s Racist Post, New York’s Top Judge Demands ‘Zero Tolerance’
headline.print_headline: New York’s Top Judge Says ‘Zero Tolerance’ for Racism in Court System

docs.abstract: Built largely by enslaved people, the building includes just one small object honoring their work.
docs.snippet: Built largely by enslaved people, the building includes just one small object honoring their work.
docs.lead_paragraph: In the culture wars that spilled over during President Donald Trump’s time in office, the most visible flash point was whether to preserve or destroy monuments depicting figures from America’s racist history.

headline.main: After the Riot, What’s the Future of Art in the Capitol?

docs.abstract: Even if we can’t impeach media companies, we can do more to hold them accountable for sowing sedition.
docs.snippet: Even if we can’t impeach media companies, we can do more to hold them accountable for sowing sedition.
docs.lead_paragraph: As America debates whether to hold former President Donald Trump accountable for inciting insurrection, what about his co-conspirator Fox News?

headline.main: Can We Put Fox News on Trial With Trump?
headline.print_headline: Can We Put Fox News on Trial With Trump?

docs.abstract: A food pantry or a place to vote — or a place to make dance with different expectations: “What we’ve taken off the table is the pressure of the result.”
docs.snippet: A food pantry or a place to vote — or a place to make dance with different expectations: “What we’ve taken off the table is the pressure of the result.”
docs.lead_paragraph: At the Henry Street Playhouse on the Lower East Side, the seats are empty but the stage is crowded. The audience is gone, banned by pandemic restrictions, yet since last summer the stage has been covered every Tuesday in hundreds of bags of groceries, lined up to be delivered by stagehands, theater staff and artists to nearby housing projects and senior homes.

headline.main: What’s a Dance Theater Without an Audience?

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Skirball Center for the Performing Arts

docs.abstract: We invite middle school and high school students to write opinion pieces on the issues that matter to them. Contest dates: Feb. 23 to April 13.
docs.snippet: We invite middle school and high school students to write opinion pieces on the issues that matter to them. Contest dates: Feb. 23 to April 13.

headline.main: Our Eighth Annual Student Editorial Contest

docs.abstract: Teenage comments in response to our recent writing prompts, and an invitation to join the ongoing conversation.
docs.snippet: Teenage comments in response to our recent writing prompts, and an invitation to join the ongoing conversation.
docs.lead_paragraph: Welcome to another roundup of student comments on our writing prompts. This week we asked teenagers if they think summer school is a good solution for students who have fallen behind academically this year; if athletes should speak out on political issues; and if they have experienced any embarrassing Zoom mishaps.

headline.main: What Students Are Saying About Summer School, Outspoken Athletes and Zoom Mishaps
